briefdescription.para: DesignWare SPI driver macros used in spi driver.

detaileddescription.para: check expressions used in DesignWare SPI driver implementation

briefdescription.para: valid check of spi info object
DesignWare SPI interrupt callback routines select macros definitions.
Static or inline functions, variables for DesignWare SPI handle spi operations, only used in this file.
test whether spi is busy, busy return 1, else 0
test whether spi is ready to send, 1 ready, 0 not ready
test whether spi is read to receive, 1 ready, 0 not ready
write data to spi send fifo
read data from spi receive fifo, return data received
send data by spi when available, mostly used in interrupt method, non-blocked function
receive one char from spi, mostly used in interrupt routine, non-blocked function
send char by spi in poll method, blocked function
receive one char from spi in poll method, blocked function
Reset designware FIFO by disable spi device, then enable device.
Enable designware spi bit interrupt with mask.
Disable designware spi bit interrupt with mask.
Set designware spi device data frame size.
Choose proper designware spi clock mode setting value.
Select a spi slave with slv_line.

detaileddescription.para: calculate spi fifo length using fifo threshold method If you attempt to set bits [7:0] of this register to a value greater than or equal to the depth of the FIFO, this field is not written and retains its current value.

briefdescription.para: disable designware spi send or receive interrupt

parameterdescription.para: control code of callback routine of send or receive

briefdescription.para: enable DesignWare SPI send or receive interrupt

parameterdescription.para: control code of callback routine of send or receive
parameter, for master, param is the freq, for slave, param is dfs
If device was opened before with different parameters, then just increase the opn_cnt and return E_OPNED
Device is opened for different mode before, if you want to open it with different mode, you need to fully close it first.
Close successfully without any issues(including scenario that device is already closed)
Device is still opened, the device opn_cnt decreased by 1
control command code to do specific spi work
parameters used to control spi or return something
Device object is not valid or not exists
Parameter is not valid for current control command
Control device failed, due to hardware issues, such as device is disabled
Control device failed, due to different reasons like in transfer state
Control command is not supported or not valid
pointer to data need to send by spi
length of data to be sent
Byte count that was successfully sent for poll method
Device object is not valid or not exists
Device is still in transfer state
Can't write data to hardware due to hardware issues, such as device is disabled
data that need to read (data must be char type)
spi has something error, nothing can be done
spi was closed, not available for control
other error code not defined here
